data.description: The infill lines usually print at a 45 degree angle. At this angle, both the X- and Y-motor work together to obtain maximum acceleration and jerk on the layer without losing quality.
data.img_description: The left image has the default diagonal infill direction, the right one has a custom [0,90] infill line direction.
data.hints:
- If the lines need to be printed in a different direction, you can set it here at 0 degrees for vertical and 90 degrees for horizontal.
- For example: [0,90] results in a horizontal-vertical top/bottom pattern.
